Navigate to other release versions of Doxee Platform Template Designer

[6.6](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/template-designer-6-6)

[6.7](https://docs.doxee.com/docs/en/template-designer-6-7)

## Styles concept
*Styles *are the approach of *Doxee Template Designer *to encapsulate *properties *of any element. That is, a *Style *is not limited to font style properties like *bold *or *italic*.

Styles can be encapsulated in style groups, per default you should have at least one, which is called *(unnamed)*, of course you can re-name it any time, e.g. by selecting it and pressing *F2*. *Styles *are created by right clicking a style group and choosing *Add style *in the context menu.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

*Figure 175. Add style*

When a style is created, a unique name within the given style group has to be specified. Having created a new *Style *any set of properties can be assigned using the *Properties view*. Existing *Styles *are assigned to an element by simply dragging it into it in the *Designer *tab or in the *Outline view*. Besides, it is also possible to assign *Styles *using the context menu of an element and entering the name of the desired *Style*. The assigned *Style *is then displayed in the *Outline view *next to the label of the element.

Using the context menu and choosing *Remove Style *a *Style *can be removed from an element.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

*Figure 176. Set or remove style*

## Style Packages
For structures bigger than a couple of paragraphs it is highly recommended to gather styles and style groups in *Infinica Style Package *files in order to increase maintain- and reusability. *Style Packages *are a simple way to compile a set of *Styles *and keep them in one file. Any *Style *within the *Style Package *can be created as described in chapter [Styles concept](/doxee-platform/docs/6-6-template-designer-user-guide-styles#styles-concept).

*Style Packages *are imported to an *Infinica Template *using the *External Resources *node in the *Outline View *choosing *Add new &gt; Infinica Template *or dragging an *Infinica Template *element from the *Palette *to the *External Resources *node and setting the source file. The source can also be changed via *Properties &gt; Advanced &gt; Miscellaneous &gt; src*.

## Composer Styles
Since version 6.4, Composer can handle styles, allowing the user to assign all the properties of a style to an element with a single action. You can use the property *composer-style *on a style group to control whether it should be available in Composer.
